summary: Not having access to affordable menstrual products (e.g., tampons or pads) may affect individuals' school attendance, employment, and mental and physical health. Our Q&A report examines states' coverage of menstrual products in their Medicaid programs. Coverage of these products is not a Medicaid benefit. But some Medicaid managed care plans may voluntarily cover some costs for eligible enrollees. We identified 25 states with at least...
title: Medicaid: Menstrual Product Coverage
